issue.title: Writing_Good_Commits.rst:  Correction in the example
issue.body:
In the starting of the Writing_Good_Commits.rst, second example of docstring typo contains the word Fixes in the issue reference which should be changed to Closes as we use Fixes for bugs only.
A good newcomer issue

issue.title: Make the code coverage reach to 100%
issue.body:
https://codecov.io/gh/coala/coala/src/master/coalib/processes/Processing.py#L65
https://codecov.io/gh/coala/coala/src/master/coalib/parsing/Globbing.py#L172
Maybe we can imporve code coverage to 100% by changing "# pragma posix: no cover" to "# pragma: no cover"

issue.title: Typo in docstring
issue.body:
In coala/coalib/settings/Setting.py,
In line 174, the word of should be replaced with off.

issue.title: coalib/bearlib/aspects/Formatting.py: Typo in importance_reason =
issue.body:
https://github.com/coala/coala/blob/master/coalib/bearlib/aspects/Formatting.py
Typo in line number 21

issue.title: Expecting a comma for clarity in Newcomers_Guide.rst
issue.body:
In the Newcomers_Guide.rst file,
in the following lines:

When you say "Hello World" in chat corobo (our gitter bot) will invite ...

a comma looks better after "chat", like:

When you say "Hello World" in chat, corobo (our gitter bot) will invite...

It sounds more clear with the comma in its place.

issue.title: Improvement in the Installation guide ( Docker Part )
issue.body:
I tried to install coala via Docker using the following guide:
https://docs.coala.io/en/latest/Users/Install.html
Not being familiar with Docker, I would have saved some time if a link for the following page was in the install via Docker section:
http://docs.coala.io/en/latest/Users/Docker_Image.html
I can do the above work; please assign this issue to me if you guys find it worth working on, thanks!

issue.title: Comma typo in Writing_Good_Commits.html file
issue.body:
In the following line in Writing Good Commit Messages, a comma is expected aftercoala.
like
At coala we are looking heavily at the maintainability of the code.
should be
At coala, we are looking heavily at the maintainability of the code.

issue.title: Missing attributes for CSS language definition
Add linter bear type 'json'
issue.body:
Many linters now emit json, and we have regular bugs when a linter is emitting json but also emits an error message on stdout.
The loading of the json can be done in coala with appropriate error checking and logging of any problems.
Also if the json is empty, the bear .run doesnt need to be invoked.

issue.title: Matlab extension is not a tuple
issue.body: extensions in coalib/bearlib/languages/definitions/Matlab.py needs to be a tuple.

issue.title: coala does not support Ignore in "subl"
issue.body:
Overview Description
Steps to Reproduce
Run this inside coala's cloned remository

echo "int add ( a , b ) { return a + b; }" >> test.c 
coala --files test.c --bears GNUIndentBear 

Actual Results
[WARNING][22:42:58] Implicit 'Default' section inheritance is deprecated. It will be removed soon. To silence this warning remove settings in the 'Default' section from your coafile. You can use dots to specify inheritance: the section 'all.python' will inherit all settings from 'all'.
Executing section python...
Executing section flakes...
Executing section autopep8...
[WARNING][22:43:00] PycodestyleBear: Exit code 1
[INFO][22:43:00] Applied 'ApplyPatchAction' on 'test.c' from 'PEP8Bear'.
test.c
[   3] int·add·(·a·,·b·)·{·return·a·+·b;·}
**** PycodestyleBear (E211) [Section: autopep8 | Severity: NORMAL] ****
!    ! E211 whitespace before '('
[    ] *0. Do (N)othing
[    ]  1. (O)pen file
[    ]  2. Add (I)gnore comment
[    ] Enter number (Ctrl-D to exit):
Next input

Enter number (Ctrl-D to exit): 2
!    ! Please enter a value for the parameter 'language' (No description given.): subl

Actual Results
[WARNING][22:44:41] coala does not support Ignore in "subl". Consider opening an issue at https://github.com/coala/coala/issues so we can add support for this language.
[    ] An ignore comment was added to your source code.
[    ] *0. Do (N)othing
[    ]  1. (O)pen file
[    ] Enter number (Ctrl-D to exit):

issue.title: Support pylint >= 2.0
issue.body:
It seems the current version of coala-bears doesn't support the newest version of pylint, thus can't run on newer versions.
On Arch Linux:
 ✘ mp@archoffice  ~/code  coala --files UPSERT_PAYMENTS_FROM_LEADR.csv --bears CSVLintBear
[WARNING][14:18:41] The default coafile '.coafile' was not found. You can generate a configuration file with your current options by adding the `--save` flag or suppress any use of config files with `-I`.
[ERROR][14:18:41] There is a conflict in the version of a dependency you have installed and the requirements of coala. This may be resolved by creating a separate virtual environment for coala or running `pip install "pylint~=1.6"`. Be aware that the latter solution might break other python packages that depend on the currently installed version.
[INFO][14:18:41] Exception was:
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coalib/coala_main.py", line 81, in run_coala
    arg_list=arg_list)

  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coalib/settings/ConfigurationGathering.py", line 387, in gather_configuration
    log_printer)

  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coalib/settings/SectionFilling.py", line 31, in fill_settings
    bear_dirs = section.bear_dirs()

  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coalib/settings/Section.py", line 116, in bear_dirs
    for bear_dir in collect_registered_bears_dirs('coalabears')]

  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coalib/collecting/Collectors.py", line 307, in collect_registered_bears_dirs
    registered_package = ep.load()

  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 2342, in load
    self.require(*args, **kwargs)

  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 2365, in require
    items = working_set.resolve(reqs, env, installer, extras=self.extras)

  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 786, in resolve
    raise VersionConflict(dist, req).with_context(dependent_req)

pkg_resources.VersionConflict: (pylint 2.1.1 (/home/mp/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages), Requirement.parse('pylint~=1.6'))

issue.title: Bear/Language search bar is broken
issue.body:
Overview Description
Search bar at https://coala.io/#/languages doesn't produce any results while searching for any query
Steps to Reproduce

Go to https://coala.io/#/languages
Search for bears/languages in the search bar

Actual Results
Nothing happens
Expected Results
Should show relevant results
Reproducibility
Additional Information:

issue.title: Update to Writing_Native_Bears and Writing_Linter_Bears
Add Ignore Comment never asks you for the parameter 'language' if you entered it wrong the first time.
issue.body:
If the user mistypes the language parameter coala shows the message - "coala does not support Ignore in "c+-". Consider opening an issue at https://github.com/coala/coala/issues so we can add support for this language." again without asking the user for the parameter 'language' so that he/she can correct it.

As you can see it only asked to enter a value for the parameter once.

issue.title: Missing value for ignore empties it
issue.body:
[missing_value]
ignore = aaa,bbb
ignore += 

[next_section]

Expected behavior:
This should throw an error, the user should fix it.
Current behavior:
Nothing gets ignored.

issue.title: Add a note to reviewers
issue.body:
Add "Check that the changes haven't been pushed from master branch" as a note to reviewers in the reviewing guide.
The wording needs to be clear enough to convey that this isn't mandatory (so that reviewers don't advice newcomers to close even their mergeable good PRs) and is just a good practice.
label: difficulty/newcomer

issue.title: Make all blocks even colored in Newcomers Guide
issue.body:
See #5119
The grey colored patches over yellow background are due to the extra colon before the exemplar commands. Just remove one colon and it will look fine.

issue.title: In `ask_for_action_and_apply()`, if `apply_single` is non-False, function should return when match is found
issue.body:
In the function ask_for_action_and_apply() in ConsoleInteraction.py, if the apply_single parameter is non-False, then the for loop inside it iterates through the entire metadata_list before returning False.
IMHO we should include a break statement inside the if block (which is in the for loop) such that the function may return after a match is found because there is no need to go through the remaining actions in metadata_list.

comments.bodyText: Hey @shashank-b! I squashed the commits and changed the commit message as described in the Newcomers' guide but the PR did not update.Would you suggest closing this one and opening another PR?I'm sorry for bothering you this much,it's my first oss contribution hence the struggle.

Hey @mk1299
Try reading about force-push. That might be useful to you. I'd suggest you use that and don't create another PR since there are duplicate PRs for this issue already. While you're at it, I'd suggest that you amend the commit on your local branch to have a space between ':' and 'Fix' in the header.
And don't worry about bothering anyone here at coala 🙂

I used force push only but it did not update the PR,only my fork.
There already is a space between : and Fix,do you want me to add another one?
@mk1299, I guess you got confused between 2 different branches. You pushed your changes to mk1299-patch-1 instead of patch-1 (which is the actual branch from which this PR is created).
@shashank-b Thanks a lot mate,that turned out to be the problem after all.Is it alright now?
@li-boxuan Please review the change.
@shashank-b I have corrected it.Anything else?

Hi @mk1299, it's coala not Coala. Please correct this in your commit message. Capital "c" should be avoided while writing "coala" anywhere (program or commit message).
Except this, everything looks in the commit message and files 👍
@KVGarg corrected it.

issue.title: Improve the code coverage
issue.body:
Processing.py: Change code coverage
Globbing.py: Change code coverage
Change # pragma posix: no cover --> # pragma: no cover
Fixes #5931

comments.bodyText:
This does not look like the right way to solve the problem. By changing # pragma posix: no cover to # pragma: no cover you are hiding the existing problem. Instead, we should find why code coverage was less than 100%.
Looks like it was because Appveyor build was failing, leading to this line not being tested.
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -169,7 +169,7 @@ def translate(pattern):
                 regex += '.*'
             # On Windows, '*' matches everything but the filesystem
             # separators '/' and '\'.
-            elif platform.system() == 'Windows':  # pragma posix: no cover
+            elif platform.system() == 'Windows':  # pragma: no cover

comments.bodyText: Looks you are right, I will close this PR later.
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -169,7 +169,7 @@ def translate(pattern):
                 regex += '.*'
             # On Windows, '*' matches everything but the filesystem
             # separators '/' and '\'.
-            elif platform.system() == 'Windows':  # pragma posix: no cover
+            elif platform.system() == 'Windows':  # pragma: no cover

defined like we require is a hard task and takes some learning. If you

for you to learn this. Just drop us a message and we'll take care of brushing

them.
 I ran coala over my code locally. (All commits have to pass
individually. It is not sufficient to have "fixup commits" on your PR,
our bot will still report the issues for the previous commit.) You will
likely receive a lot of bot comments and build failures if coala does not
pass on every single commit!

comments.bodyText: Coala should not be capitalized
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -597,5 +597,7 @@ For example, let's make an aspect bear named SpellingCheckBear.
                         message='Wrong spelling in word `{}`'.format(word),
                         aspect=DictionarySpelling('py'),
                     )
+.. note::
+    Coala uses 1-based line & column convention, i.e. the first line and first column are 1. However, some linter use 0-based convention. For example ``pylint`` uses 1-based line convention and 0-based column convention. We need to map these conventions, please refer to `Normalize line or Column convention <https://coala-api.netlify.com/developers/writing_linter_bears#normalize-line-or-column-numbers>`__.

comments.bodyText: @AkshJain99 I already fixed the gitmate issues in the second commit. Also, even though it is not tagged as a bug, don't you think it should be one? I'll change it nonetheless.
@tanmaysachan  i dont think that it should be tagged as a bug because your are adding a feature to it and not fixing anything (due to which some feature is not working)

Also you have not fixed gitmate problem pls look at it once again
…
On Wed, 12 Dec 2018, 9:42 pm GitMate ***@***.*** wrote:
 Comment on 2b57728
 <2b57728>
 .

 Shortlog of the HEAD commit contains 65 character(s). This is 15
 character(s) longer than the limit (65 > 50).

 *Origin: GitCommitBear, Section: commit.*

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#5913 (comment)>, or mute
 the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AcS9h_Y7eWSXZM3MLS6h3pJZT8jB6I7pks5u4SrfgaJpZM4ZPbtd>
 .
@AkshJain99 Yeah sorry, forgot a small one :p
@tanmaysachan  Travis is failing, you need to add tests.
@akshatkarani Alright I will alter the patch accordingly.
@akshatkarani I guess this is more in line to what the issue wanted. Yet to add tests.
Looks good, now make travis green.

@akshatkarani I could add this by perhaps creating a specific keyword (say "ABORT" in all caps) to abort the action. But it would become incredibly specific (one specific keyword for one parameter for one action as well as a different output question which specifies this keyword). Should I still go ahead with it?
Is there any alternate way to achieve this? Because I dont see any way other than a keyword.
2 ways I could think of:

My first commit, just add the action to failed_actions and let the user chose the action again.
Make this keyword applicable to all actions, such that it aborts any action currently running, when supplied with the "ABORT" parameter, and not necessarily IgnoreResultAction.
@tanmaysachan  Well you could ask user whether he wants to go back.
@akshatkarani where exactly? Do you want me to add another option when the user is being asked for params? As in, "enter 'O' to abort the action", alongside the enter the language message?
After user enters the language and it asks for language again, give two options either enter the language again or go back. This would be good IMO.
@akshatkarani yeah that's what i meant about the code becoming too specific. But if you're okay with that then cool, ill implement it.

Its better to someone else's opinion on this.
@jayvdb  What do you think should be done?
@jayvdb any suggestions?
